page.title: 02HAZELDOWN FARM,LECKFORD EST.
page.content: {HAZELDOWN FARM WAS BUILT IN THE 1700S {WHEN QUEEN ANNE RULED. THE BURNFIELDS {HAVE OWNED THE FARM SINCE 1907. THE {BURNFIELDS ORIGINALLY CAME FROM {SCOTLAND. THEY HAVE 13 FIELDS {TOTALLING 220 ACRES MAINLY SOWING {BARLEY AND GRASS FOR SILAGE.THE FARM {EMPLOYS 8 WORKERS ; 1 MILKER, {1 MECHANIC, 1 FARM WORKER, MR {BURNFIELD,HIS 2 SISTERS,AND ONE OLD {AGED PENSIONER. THEY HAVE 130 MILKING {FRIESIANS 32 CALVES 33 YEARLINGS 2 {BULLS AND 45 BEEF CATTLE.THE FARM ALSO {HAS COMBINES,TRACTORS AND BAILERS. { THE LECKFORD ESTATE WATER WHEEL WAS BUILT IN THE 1930S. THE RIVER TURNS THE WHEEL WHICH PUMPS WATER FROM THE WELL TO THE RESEVOIR;IT SUPPLIES LONGSTOCK HOUSE AND PART OF LONGSTOCK VILLAGE WITH WATER.
